title: ‘Murky Waters’ for Global Businesses After Trump’s Tariff Loss
summary: Even after the Supreme Court invalidated many of the president’s levies, foreign leaders and executives assume that U.S. tariffs are here to stay, in one form or another.

title: Trump Doubles Down on Closing Tax Loophole on Cheap Imports
summary: The exemption was shut down last year by President Trump based, in part, on the same legal grounds as the tariffs that were invalidated by the Supreme Court.

title: With Tariff Changes, Consumers May Be Stuck in a Waiting Game
summary: Some companies could decide to temper price increases, but the effect would take time to materialize.

title: In Gorsuch’s Homage to Legislative Power, a Subtle Reproach of a Neutered Congress
summary: In his concurrence to the ruling invalidating President Trump’s tariffs, Justice Neil M. Gorsuch made a forceful case for the sanctity of the legislative process — and an implicit critique of its current dysfunction.

title: Bench Presses, Pull Ups … Kid Rock? The White House Had a Very Manly Week.
summary: President Trump’s top cabinet officials are pumping iron in public.

title: Bridge Owner Donated $1 Million to MAGA Group Before Trump Blasted Competitor
summary: The PAC and the White House say the donation had nothing to do with President Trump’s tirade against a new bridge connecting Detroit and Windsor, Ontario.

title: Longtime Virginia Lawyer Chosen by Judges as U.S. Attorney, and Then Fired
summary: It was the second time this month that the administration had gotten rid of a top federal prosecutor appointed to his post by federal judges.

title: Judge Rebukes U.S. Over Application to Search Washington Post Reporter’s Home
summary: A prosecutor apologized for failing to alert the magistrate to a 1980 law that restricts searches for reporting materials.

title: Alysa Liu Trusted Her Artistry in Her Olympic Free Skate
summary: Competition can wreck a figure skater, but Liu and other Olympians shed the pressure and delivered transcendent performances focused on artistry.

title: Los Angeles Olympics Have a Cloud of Concerns as Winter Games Close
summary: New details about the LA28 chairman’s ties to Jeffrey Epstein, as well as anxiety over key infrastructure projects, have thrown the planning into disarray.

title: Why Attacking Iran Could Be Riskier Than Capturing Maduro
summary: Iran’s extensive military abilities and network of regional proxies could draw the United States into a prolonged conflict.

title: U.S. Planes Land at Jordan Base, a Key Hub for Planning Possible Iran Strikes
summary: At least 60 attack aircraft are parked at the base, which has become a key hub for U.S. military planning for possible strikes on Iran.

title: He Researched Dishonesty. He Got Friendly With Jeffrey Epstein.
summary: Dan Ariely, a behavioral scientist at Duke, sought out the convicted sex offender for his research. Their yearslong correspondence suggests it wasn’t all business.

title: Shocker! SCOTUS Schools POTUS
summary: The high court asserts itself as tariff sheriff.

title: ‘A Cocked Pistol Aimed at Iran’
summary: Three Opinion writers on Iran, Epstein and what power really looks like.

title: At A.I. Summit, India Tries to Find a Way Between the U.S. and China
summary: India is using technology as a tool of foreign policy, casting itself as a moral voice for smaller, developing countries.

title: Another Winter Storm Could Deliver More Snow to the Northeast This Weekend
summary: Forecasts on Friday began to make another major snowstorm look far more likely. Snow is expected to begin falling Sunday.

title: Ruben Ray Martinez Was Killed in an Undisclosed ICE Shooting in March, His Family Says
summary: A 23-year-old American was shot last March in South Padre Island. ICE’s involvement in the shooting was not disclosed until this week.

title: These Skiers Cleared Out as Group That Would Be Hit by Avalanche Arrived
summary: If the party had waited out the storm in their cabins, one of the skiers said, the outcome might have been different.
